intro: Miconia asplundii, commonly known as the asplundii miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and humid woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
